SEARCH
Package AlgorithmCode

Class HashTwoD

java.lang.Object
AlgorithmCode.HashTwoDhexadecimal
public class HashTwoD extends Object
Contains hash functions for 2D arrays/bitmap hashing, inversions, and testing

    Sets the Hash manager function

  • Constructor Details

    • HashTwoD

      public HashTwoD(Hash inhash)
      Sets the Hash manager function
      Parameters:
      inhash - instance of manager class

  • Method Details

    • hashArray

      public int[][][] hashArray(int[][] input, int rule, int depth, boolean minimize, boolean rowError)
      Hashes 2D data with the given parameters, hash-in-place version
      Parameters:
      input - a 2D array of hashed data
      rule - a 0-255 ECA rule
      depth - iterative depth, also the power of how far away its neighbors are at each step
      minimize - if true, uses the error-minimizing codewords, and if false uses the error-maximizing codewords
      rowError - if true, uses the row-weighted codewords, and if false uses the column-weighted codewords
      Returns:
      hashed input data

    • hashArrayCompression

      public int[][] hashArrayCompression(int[][] input, int rule, int depth, boolean minimize, boolean rowError)
      Hashes a 2D array of hexadecimal data with the given parameters, compression version
      Parameters:
      input - a 2D array of data to be hashed
      rule - a 0-255 ECA rule
      depth - iterative depth
      minimize - if true uses the minimizing codeword set of the rule, if false uses the maximizing codewords
      rowError - if true uses the row-weighted errorScore truth tables, if false uses the column-weighted tables
      Returns:
      the input data, hashed

    • invert

      public int[][] invert(int[][] input, int depth, int rule, boolean minimize, boolean rowError)
      Computes the inverse transformation of a 2D array of hashed data using a voting mechanism, single codeword set
      Parameters:
      input - a 2D array of integers representing the hashed input data
      depth - an integer indicating how far away neighbors are considered (powers of 2, e.g., 2^n)
      rule - 0-255 ECA rule
      minimize - whether this is a minimization codeword or a maximization codeword
      rowError - a boolean indicating whether row-based or column-based processing is used
      Returns:
      a 2D array of integers representing the rehashed inverse-transformed data

    • invert

      public int[][] invert(int[][][] input, int depth)
      Computes the inverse of a 2D array of hashed data using a voting mechanism using all 32 codewords
      Parameters:
      input - 32 codeword sets of 2D hashed data, input[codeword][row][column]
      depth - an integer indicating how far away neighbors are considered (powers of 2, e.g., 2^n)
      Returns:
      a 2D array of integers representing the rehashed inverse-transformed data

    • hashBitmap

      public void hashBitmap(String filepath, int rule, boolean minimize, boolean rowError) throws IOException
      Loads a bitmap, eca hash transforms it, displays it, makes a .gif file using the given parameters
      Parameters:
      filepath - name of the file, not including the directory path
      rule - 0-255 ECA rule to use
      minimize - if true, uses the minimizing codewords, if false uses the maximizing codewords
      rowError - if true, uses the row-weighted errorScore, if false uses the column-weighted errorScore
      Throws:
      IOException

    • writeGif

      public void writeGif(short[][][] frames, String filepath, int depth, BufferedImage inImage) throws IOException
      Generates a gif from hashed data in hashBitmap(), uses AnimatedGifEncoder
      Parameters:
      frames - hashed data from hashBitmap(), frames[a][row][column] where frames[a] is a single frame of the gif
      filepath - name and location of where to put the gif
      depth - depth of iteration, how many frames
      inImage - passed as a parameter mostly for the inImage.getHeight() and .getWidth() information
      Throws:
      IOException

    • verifyInverseAndAvalanche

      public void verifyInverseAndAvalanche(String filepath) throws IOException
      This function experimentally tests the inverse operation and the avalanche property on a hashed bitmap
      Parameters:
      filepath - name of the file, not including the directory path
      Throws:
      IOException
